intro: Zerna benekenii, commonly known as the Beneken's zerna, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and small, narrow leaves. The plant produces tiny, spikelet-like flowers that are typically green or brown in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Zerna benekenii is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical species.
